Medicine_tweet_170.News Finding: Abstract: Teens who regularly use synthetic cannabinoids more likely 2 report polydrug use than marijuana-only users
Medicine_tweet_170.Paper Finding: Marijuana users who use other drugs in particular are at highest risk for currently using SCs, so particular focus needs to be paid to these individuals at high risk.
Medicine_tweet_170.News Context: Abstract: Teens who regularly use synthetic cannabinoids more likely 2 report polydrug use than marijuana-only users
Medicine_tweet_170.Paper Context: Although previous studies have revealed that marijuana users are at high risk for use, this study revealed risk factors among current marijuana users that increase risk of current use and higher-frequency use of SCs. Prevention needs to be focused primarily on marijuana users, especially marijuana users with risk factors discovered in this analysis. Marijuana users who use other drugs in particular are at highest risk for currently using SCs, so particular focus needs to be paid to these individuals at high risk.
Medicine_tweet_170.text:
Reported finding: Abstract: Teens who regularly use synthetic cannabinoids more likely 2 report polydrug use than marijuana-only users
Paper finding: Marijuana users who use other drugs in particular are at highest risk for currently using SCs, so particular focus needs to be paid to these individuals at high risk.

Paper finding: Marijuana users who use other drugs in particular are at highest risk for currently using SCs, so particular focus needs to be paid to these individuals at high risk.

Medicine_tweet_10.News Finding: Acute lesions on diffusion #MRI of the brain could predict delayed neurological sequelae following acute CO poisoning.
Medicine_tweet_10.Paper Finding: Multivariable logistic regression analysis indicated that the presence of acute brain lesions was independently associated with development of delayed neurological sequelae (adjusted odds ratio, 13.93; 95% CI, 7.16-27.11; P < .001).
Medicine_tweet_10.News Context: Acute lesions on diffusion #MRI of the brain could predict delayed neurological sequelae following acute CO poisoning.
Medicine_tweet_10.Paper Context: Multivariable logistic regression analysis indicated that the presence of acute brain lesions was independently associated with development of delayed neurological sequelae (adjusted odds ratio, 13.93; 95% CI, 7.16-27.11; P < .001). The sensitivity and specificity of acute brain lesions to assess the probability of delayed neurological sequelae were 75.2% (95% CI, 66.8%-83.7%) and 90.2% (95% CI, 86.8%-93.7%), respectively. In addition, the positive and negative predictive values were 73.1% (95% CI, 64.6%-81.6%) and 91.2% (95% CI, 87.9%-94.5%), respectively.
Medicine_tweet_10.text:
Reported finding: Acute lesions on diffusion #MRI of the brain could predict delayed neurological sequelae following acute CO poisoning.
Paper finding: Multivariable logistic regression analysis indicated that the presence of acute brain lesions was independently associated with development of delayed neurological sequelae (adjusted odds ratio, 13.93; 95% CI, 7.16-27.11; P < .001).
Medicine_tweet_10.displayed_text:

Paper finding: Multivariable logistic regression analysis indicated that the presence of acute brain lesions was independently associated with development of delayed neurological sequelae (adjusted odds ratio, 13.93; 95% CI, 7.16-27.11; P < .001).

Medicine_tweet_7.News Finding:
High School Students’ Use of Electronic Cigarettes to Vaporize Cannabis
Morean PhD, Kong PhD et alPediatrics Oct 2015
Medicine_tweet_7.Paper Finding: The current study is the first to demonstrate that HS students are using e-cigarettes to vaporize cannabis.
Medicine_tweet_7.News Context:
High School Students’ Use of Electronic Cigarettes to Vaporize Cannabis
Morean PhD, Kong PhD et alPediatrics Oct 2015
Medicine_tweet_7.Paper Context: Using e-cigarettes to vaporize cannabis did not differ significantly by students' SES (P = .23). The current study is the first to demonstrate that HS students are using e-cigarettes to vaporize cannabis. Of central importance, rates of using e-cigarettes to vaporize cannabis were high among all students who had ever tried an e-cigarette, among all students who had tried any form of cannabis, and among the subsample of students who had experimented with the combination of e-cigarettes and cannabis (.4% of the total sample, 18.0% of lifetime e-cigarette users, 18.4% of lifetime cannabis users, and 26.% of lifetime dual users).
Medicine_tweet_7.text:
Reported finding: High School Students’ Use of Electronic Cigarettes to Vaporize Cannabis Morean PhD, Kong PhD et alPediatrics Oct 2015
Paper finding: The current study is the first to demonstrate that HS students are using e-cigarettes to vaporize cannabis.

Medicine_tweet_14.News Finding: Our new paper using MTurk finds no evidence that artificial monitoring cues influence online donations to charity
Medicine_tweet_14.Paper Finding: This work supports the importance of cultural differences and enduring individual differences in prosocial behaviour and shows that a range of artificial monitoring cues do not reliably boost online charity donation on MTurk.
Medicine_tweet_14.News Context: Our new paper using MTurk finds no evidence that artificial monitoring cues influence online donations to charity
Medicine_tweet_14.Paper Context: By contrast, the control variables of culture, age, sex and previous charity giving frequency did predict donations. This work supports the importance of cultural differences and enduring individual differences in prosocial behaviour and shows that a range of artificial monitoring cues do not reliably boost online charity donation on MTurk. None of the monitoring primes we tested had a significant effect on charitable giving.
Medicine_tweet_14.text:
Reported finding: Our new paper using MTurk finds no evidence that artificial monitoring cues influence online donations to charity
Paper finding: This work supports the importance of cultural differences and enduring individual differences in prosocial behaviour and shows that a range of artificial monitoring cues do not reliably boost online charity donation on MTurk.

Paper finding: This work supports the importance of cultural differences and enduring individual differences in prosocial behaviour and shows that a range of artificial monitoring cues do not reliably boost online charity donation on MTurk.
